title: Why Is The Coronavirus So Good At Spreading?
description:
Ed Yong rounds up some theories in a recent article for The Atlantic. He tells host Maddie Sofia one reason the virus spreads so well might have to do with an enzyme commonly found in human tissue.

Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.

itunes:title: Why Is The Coronavirus So Good At Spreading?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Ed Yong, writer for The Atlantic, says the coronavirus has a few traits that seem to make it especially effective at infecting humans.
